org.flossware.jcore.utils

Class LoggerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flossware.jcore.utils.LoggerUtils

  • public final class LoggerUtils
extends Object
    A logger utility class that adds the ability to log and return values as well as present a var args array to log vs creating an object array to log multiple things. As an example, one typically will do this for a multi output log: public static void doSomething() { logger.log(Level.FINE, "This is some output {0} that include this {1} and that {2}", new Object[] {someVal0, someVal1, someVal2}); } A better (simpler notation) is to use var args like so: public static void doSomething() { LoggerUtils.log(logger, Level.FINE, "This is some output {0} that include this {1} and that {2}", someVal0, someVal1, someVal2); } Additional functionality contained in this class allows for log and return a value. Useful in places where a computation as a return value and that computation method is solely a one line return statement. As an example: public static Foo computeVal() { return someVal + someOtherVal; } To log, we may need to do this: public static Foo computeVal() { Foo retVal = someVal + someOtherVal; getLogger().log(Level.FINE, "The return value = {0}", retVal); return retVal; } Using this utility logger class, we can simplify this by doing: public static Foo computeVal() { return LoggerUtils.logAndReturn(getLogger(), Level.FINE, "The return value = {0}", someVal + someOtherVal); }
    Author:
    Scot P. Floess

                       Throwable throwable,
                       String str,

        Performs a log using the var args objs as an array that can be presented to the logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - the logger to use.
        level - the level of the log.
        throwable - the throwable to log with str.
        str - the format string.
        objs - a var arg thats converted to an object array for logging.

        Parameters:

        level - the level of the log.
        str - the format string.

        objs - a var arg thats converted to an object array for logging.
        Returns:
